borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed side extension by reason of its irregular design&nbsp;is not considered to be subordinate to the existing house and unbalances the symmetry of the semi detached pair. In addition, it proposes&nbsp;a thin corridor which provides unusable living space not connected to the main house.&nbsp;</span>This is considered harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies SP 2,&nbsp;DMD 1 and DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt;">The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of producing a&nbsp;discordant roof line&nbsp;fails to compliment the appearance of the original dwellinghouse and semi detached pair.&nbsp;</span>This is considered harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></p><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies SP 2,&nbsp;DMD 1 and DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>
description: Construction single storey side extension, part single and part double storey rear extension
